revised_title: Applications of Mass Spectrometry in Structural Studies of Bioactive Compounds
tldr: The article discusses the use of mass spectrometry in the structural studies of bioactive compounds, focusing on molluscicidal saponins from dogwood, the adducts formed between 7,12-dimethyl-benz[a]anthracene and nucleic acids, and the G2 factor, a natural mitotic hormone that regulates cell proliferation.
